tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE air_quality_measurements (
    sensor_id INT NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    pollutant_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    pollutant_level FLOAT NOT NULL,
    location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (sensor_id, timestamp)
);

CREATE TABLE AirQualityMeasurements (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    measurement_value FLOAT,
    measurement_unit VARCHAR(50),
    measurement_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE PollutionSensors (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
    installation_date DATE,
    last_calibration_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE air_quality_measurements (
    measurement_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INTEGER,
    location VARCHAR(50),
    pollutant_type VARCHAR(50),
    pollutant_level FLOAT,
    measurement_datetime TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE pollution_sensors (
    sensor_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_location VARCHAR(100),
    installation_date DATE,
    last_calibration_date DATE,
    sensor_type VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE AirQualitySensor (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location_name VARCHAR(255),
    measurement_time TIMESTAMP,
    pollutant_type VARCHAR(50),
    pollutant_level FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE SensorLocation (
    location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location_name VARCHAR(255),
    city VARCHAR(100),
    latitude DECIMAL(10, 8),
    longitude DECIMAL(11, 8)
);

CREATE TABLE PollutionAlert (
    alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    alert_time TIMESTAMP,
    alert_level VARCHAR(20),
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES AirQualitySensor(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE AirQualityMeasurements ( 
  sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  location_id INT, 
  measurement_time TIMESTAMP, 
  pollutant_type VARCHAR(50), 
  measurement_value FLOAT 
);
